speaker: Manager (Leo)
text: Hey! Just wanted to catch up and see how the new authentication flow is going.
ipa: heɪ | dʒəst ˈwɑːnɪd tə kæʧ ʌp ənd si haʊ ðə nuː ɔːˌθɛn.tɪˈkeɪ.ʃən floʊ ɪz ˈɡoʊ.ɪŋ
stress: HEY | JUST WANTED TO CATCH UP and SEE HOW the NEW AUTHENTICATION FLOW is GOING
linking:
"wanted to" → /ˈwɑːnɪd tə/ (to reduced)
"catch up and" → /kæʧ ʌp ənd/ (smooth consonant + vowel)
"see how" → /si haʊ/ (smooth verb + question word)

speaker: You
text: Hey Leo! Yeah, things are moving forward. I was going to finish it yesterday, but I got caught up in a bug related to token refresh.
ipa: heɪ ˈliː.oʊ | jæ | θɪŋz ɑːr ˈmuːvɪŋ ˈfɔrwɚd | aɪ wəz ˈɡoʊɪŋ tə ˈfɪnɪʃ ɪt ˈjɛstɚdeɪ | bət aɪ ɡɑt kɔt ʌp ɪn ə bʌɡ rɪˈleɪtɪd tə ˈtoʊkən rɪˈfrɛʃ
stress: HEY LEO | YEAH | THINGS ARE MOVING FORWARD | I WAS GOING TO FINISH IT YESTERDAY | BUT I GOT CAUGHT UP in a BUG RELATED TO TOKEN REFRESH
linking:
"going to" → /ˈɡoʊɪŋ tə/ (to reduced)
"finish it" → /ˈfɪnɪʃ ɪt/ (sh + it linked)
"caught up in" → /kɔt ʌp ɪn/ (link T + up + in)
"related to" → /rɪˈleɪtɪd tə/ (to reduced)

speaker: Leo
text: No worries — happens to all of us. Do you think you will be able to wrap it up by tomorrow?
ipa: noʊ ˈwɝːriz | ˈhæpənz tə ɔːl əv ʌs | dʊ jə θɪŋk ju wɪl bi ˈeɪbəl tə ræp ɪt ʌp baɪ təˈmɑːroʊ
stress: NO WORRIES | HAPPENS TO ALL OF US | DO YOU THINK YOU WILL BE ABLE TO WRAP IT UP BY TOMORROW
linking:
"happens to" → /ˈhæpənz tə/ (to reduced)
"do you" → /dʊ jə/ (you reduced)
"wrap it up" → /ræp ɪt ʌp/ (T links to it and up)

speaker: You
text: Yeah, I’m confident I will have finished everything by tomorrow afternoon. I’m just polishing the error handling.
ipa: jæ | aɪm ˈkɑːnfɪdənt aɪ wɪl həv ˈfɪnɪʃt ˈɛvrɪθɪŋ baɪ təˈmɑːroʊ ˌæftɚˈnuːn | aɪm dʒəst ˈpɑːlɪʃɪŋ ði ˈɛrɚ ˈhændlɪŋ
stress: YEAH | I’M CONFIDENT I WILL HAVE FINISHED EVERYTHING BY TOMORROW AFTERNOON | I’M JUST POLISHING the ERROR HANDLING
linking:
"will have" → /wɪl həv/ (have reduced)
"finished everything" → /ˈfɪnɪʃt ˈɛvrɪθɪŋ/ (T links smoothly)
"just polishing" → /dʒəst ˈpɑːlɪʃɪŋ/ (just links into verb)

speaker: Leo
text: Sounds good. What’s the next step after that?
ipa: saʊndz ɡʊd | wʌts ðə nɛkst stɛp ˈæftɚ ðæt
stress: SOUNDS GOOD | WHAT’S THE NEXT STEP AFTER THAT
linking:
"what’s the" → /wʌts ðə/ (contraction + reduced article)
"step after" → /stɛp ˈæftɚ/ (p links into after)

speaker: You
text: I am planning to move on to the front-end integration. By Friday, I will be working with Dana to get everything hooked up.
ipa: aɪ əm ˈplænɪŋ tə muːv ɑn tə ðə ˈfrʌnt ˌɛnd ˌɪntɪˈɡreɪʃən | baɪ ˈfraɪdeɪ | aɪ wɪl bi ˈwɝːkɪŋ wɪð ˈdeɪnə tə ɡɛt ˈɛvrɪθɪŋ hʊkt ʌp
stress: I’M PLANNING TO MOVE ON TO THE FRONT-END INTEGRATION | BY FRIDAY | I’LL BE WORKING WITH DANA TO GET EVERYTHING HOOKED UP
linking:
"to move on to" → /tə muːv ɑn tə/ (multiple reductions)
"working with" → /ˈwɝːkɪŋ wɪð/ (smooth connection)
"hooked up" → /hʊkt ʌp/ (T links to up)

speaker: Leo
text: Perfect. And for the sprint demo next week?
ipa: ˈpɝːfɪkt | ənd fər ðə sprɪnt ˈdɛmoʊ nɛkst wiːk
stress: PERFECT | AND FOR THE SPRINT DEMO NEXT WEEK
linking:
"and for" → /ənd fər/ (and reduced)
"next week" → /nɛkst wiːk/ (T links into W)

speaker: You
text: If everything goes well, we will have completed the full flow by Monday. We are going to run some basic user tests over the weekend too.
ipa: ɪf ˈɛvrɪθɪŋ ɡoʊz wɛl | wi wɪl həv kəmˈpliːtɪd ðə fʊl floʊ baɪ ˈmʌndeɪ | wi ɑːr ˈɡoʊɪŋ tə rʌn səm ˈbeɪsɪk ˈjuːzɚ tɛsts ˈoʊvɚ ðə ˈwiːkɛnd tuː
stress: IF EVERYTHING GOES WELL | WE WILL HAVE COMPLETED THE FULL FLOW BY MONDAY | WE ARE GOING TO RUN BASIC USER TESTS OVER THE WEEKEND TOO
linking:
"will have" → /wɪl həv/ (have reduced)
"going to run" → /ˈɡoʊɪŋ tə rʌn/ (to reduced)
"tests over" → /tɛsts ˈoʊvɚ/ (S links into vowel)

speaker: Leo
text: Nice. Just make sure we don’t fall behind on the timeline. The product team is counting on this feature.
ipa: naɪs | dʒəst meɪk ʃʊr wi doʊnt fɑːl bɪˈhaɪnd ɑn ðə ˈtaɪmlaɪn | ðə ˈprɑːdʌkt tiːm ɪz ˈkaʊntɪŋ ɑn ðɪs ˈfiːʧɚ
stress: NICE | JUST MAKE SURE WE DON’T FALL BEHIND ON THE TIMELINE | THE PRODUCT TEAM IS COUNTING ON THIS FEATURE
linking:
"don’t fall" → /doʊnt fɑːl/ (t links into verb)
"counting on" → /ˈkaʊntɪŋ ɑn/ (smooth verb + preposition)

speaker: You
text: Absolutely. I’ve already blocked off time for bug fixing next week just in case.
ipa: ˌæbsəˈluːtli | aɪv ɔːlˈrɛdi blɑːkt ɔf taɪm fər bʌɡ ˈfɪksɪŋ nɛkst wiːk | dʒəst ɪn keɪs
stress: ABSOLUTELY | I’VE ALREADY BLOCKED OFF TIME FOR BUG FIXING NEXT WEEK | JUST IN CASE
linking:
"blocked off" → /blɑːkt ɔf/ (T links into off)
"next week" → /nɛkst wiːk/ (T links into week)

speaker: Leo
text: Good thinking. Let me know if you run into any blockers — I’ll try to free up support if needed.
ipa: ɡʊd ˈθɪŋkɪŋ | lɛt mi noʊ ɪf ju rʌn ˈɪntu ˈɛni ˈblɑːkɚz | aɪl traɪ tə fri ʌp səˈpɔrt ɪf ˈniːdɪd
stress: GOOD THINKING | LET ME KNOW IF YOU RUN INTO ANY BLOCKERS | I’LL TRY TO FREE UP SUPPORT IF NEEDED
linking:
"let me" → /lɛt mi/ (T links into pronoun)
"try to" → /traɪ tə/ (to reduced)

speaker: You
text: Thanks, Leo! Appreciate the support — I’ll keep you posted.
ipa: θæŋks ˈliː.oʊ | əˈpriːʃieɪt ðə səˈpɔrt | aɪl kiːp ju ˈpoʊstɪd
stress: THANKS, LEO | APPRECIATE THE SUPPORT | I’LL KEEP YOU POSTED
linking:
"keep you" → /kiːp ju/ (smooth verb + pronoun)
"I’ll keep" → /aɪl kiːp/ (contraction)
